title: Two breaking changes to "push_bulk" in 4.1.2 related to arguments
body:
The break was introduced in this commit: https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/commit/59061042c9718bf6dce021820e6297e5096489d2

1) Previously you could pass an empty array to `push_bulk` and it would be a no-op. Now it raises:

**Before (v4.1.1):**

``` ruby
class MyJob
  include Sidekiq::Worker

  def perform
  end
end

2.3.1 :008 > Sidekiq::Client.push_bulk('class' => MyJob, 'args' => [])
 => []
```

**After (v4.1.2):**

``` ruby
class MyJob
  include Sidekiq::Worker

  def perform
  end
end

2.3.1 :008 > Sidekiq::Client.push_bulk('class' => MyJob, 'args' => [])
ArgumentError: Bulk arguments must be an Array of Arrays: [[1], [2]]
```

2) Also, this now only validates the first argument:

**Before (v4.1.1):**

``` ruby
2.3.1 :008 > Sidekiq::Client.push_bulk('class' => MyJob, 'args' => [[], 'not-an-array'])
ArgumentError: Bulk arguments must be an Array of Arrays: [[1], [2]]
```

**After (v4.1.2):**

``` ruby
2.3.1 :008 > Sidekiq::Client.push_bulk('class' => MyJob, 'args' => [[], 'not-an-array'])
 => ["27679d5395ecf1bacd3112dc", "aaa650e00c64dfcf9b85db5e"] 
```

---

FWIW, my use-case for the first one is something like:

``` ruby
def enqueue_jobs
  Sidekiq::Client.push_bulk(
    'class' => MyJob,
    'args' => some_method_that_returns_an_array
  )
end
```

I could refactor it to something like this, but I feel the former is cleaner and more ruby-esque (e.g. `[].each` is just a no-op, it doesn't raise):

``` ruby
def enqueue_jobs
  array = some_method_that_returns_an_array
  return if array.empty?

  Sidekiq::Client.push_bulk(
    'class' => MyJob,
    'args' => array
  )
end
```
